intro: Cortusina velutina, commonly known as the velvetleaf cortusina, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its smooth, velvety leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wetlands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
